main event: Four diamond-shaped objects were observed flying in a northwesterly direction over Ferndale, Michigan, on April 15, 1957.
interesting points: The objects were described as being the size of twice the largest star., The sighting lasted approximately four minutes., It was noted that the weather conditions were very clear during the observation., The observation was classified as negative for aircraft sightings in the area at the time., The conclusion drawn was that the sighting was probably caused by an aircraft.
